metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5448 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An out-of-bounds write in "ClearKeyDecryptor" while decrypting some Clearkey-encrypted media content. The "ClearKeyDecryptor" code runs within the Gecko Media Plugin (GMP) sandbox. If a second mechanism is found to escape the sandbox, this vulnerability allows for the writing of arbitrary data within memory, resulting in a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 45.9, Firefox ESR < 52.1, and Firefox < 53.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5448` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 53.0+build6-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 53.0+build6-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 53.0+build6-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 53.0+build6-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '53.0+build6-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
